summary:
Over 20 years of working experience in the energy sector. My passion is delivering technical innovative challenging projects. In such an environment I am in my comfort zone and able to deliver added value. 
    
Within a world that is in transition to a sustainable energy future my mission is to contribute by connecting the conventional and the renewable offshore energy sector.  In the next decades we need both conventional and renewable energy and I ’m convinced that we can achieve a sustainable energy supply by working together. To make a successful energy transition, sharing knowledge and experience between the conventional and renewable sector is a key issue.  

Background: have fulfilled several key positions within Energy companies, DCS/ESD vendors and Engineering Procurement Construction (EPC) companies by leading multi-disciplinary teams that engineer, procure, construct and commission energy related projects. My solid technical background coupled with leadership skills have made it possible to deliver projects that were classified by management as ‘critical for business’ on time and within budget.

profile_positions.title: Founder and CEO

profile_positions.description:
Currently working within NAM, a Shell-ExxonMobil joint venture. NAM is the leading oil and gas operator in the Netherlands and has its headquarters in Assen. Its core business is exploring for and producing oil and gas, both on land and offshore.

For the offshore facilities a dedicated department called ONEmods is recently formed to process modifications that are primary focused on lifetime extension of platforms. Modifications follow the, by Shell developed, Opportunity Realization Process (ORP).
 
In my current role I’m heading a multi-discipline team of process, mechanical/piping, instrumentation, PACO, electrical, rotation and technical safety engineers. As a team we execute the front end development phase (Assess/Select and Define) for modifications at Dutch offshore platforms. During Assess phase we investigate the opportunity and/or define the root cause of a problem. During Select we develop numerous options, and by evaluating the advantages and disadvantages of each option the preferred solution it selected. This solution is developed in further detail (maturing the scope) during Define. Each change proposal is technically evaluated and approved by the Technical Authorities within NAM. The decision review board takes the Final Investment Decision (FID) and, if go-ahead is received the job is handed to the engineering contractor for the Execute phase. 

Due to the attitude developed in the team we were able to adress the root cause of the problem. By addressing the root cause and not the symptoms we saved the company hundreds of thousands of euros.

Over the last 12 months we processed 60+ modifications and delivered solid technical and commercial viable change requests. Some examples of the executed front end engineering projects are:
•	MEG loading (including O2 stripping) and unloading for offshore platform
•	Rejuvenation of K7A Platform power supply (solar – diesel generator concept)
•	Emission reduction for Gas Treatment centre
profile_positions.title: Front end development project engineer

profile_positions.description:
For the Land department of NAM I have led a dedicated team for a number of complex control and safeguarding systems. Together we executed multiple projects from basis engineering up to and including startup. Some examples are:
•	Collendoornerveen gas treatment center: Foxboro DCS upgrade and HIMA ESD upgrade
•	Kootstertille compressor station: Foxboro DCS and Yokogawa ESD replacement
•	Grijpskerk gas treatment center: Yokogawa DCS upgrade and ESD replacement
•	Tietjerksteradeel gas treatment center: Siemens DCS upgrade

Typical activities managed are:
•	development of engineering packages released for construction
•	procurement 
•	factory acceptance testing
•	development of commissioning packages and planning
•	construction
•	commissioning and startup

For all of these projects it was extremely important to deliver the projects according plan as every hour delay would result in gas deferment.  We succeeded to do so because we:
•	set up a dedicated team, 
•	developed robust execution plans, 
•	focused on team motivation,
•	collaborate with relevant parties such as vendors and suppliers, and 
•	we were willing to perform the work required to finish the job.
profile_positions.title: Project Lead

profile_positions.description:
VOGN management contacted me in December 2012 and requested to execute the Middenmeer Treatment Centre Pneumatic Retrofit project in a very short timeframe. The scope of this project included the complete rejuvenation of a gas treatment center.  Given the age of the pneumatic control and safeguarding equipment (30 years) it was desired to replace it with a state of the art electronic control  & safeguarding system. The scope furthermore included replacement of all transmitters, switches, control and safeguarding valves,  power supply (new transformer), MCC, marshalling cabinets, DCS/ESD cabinets, burner management system (water bath heater and flare), instrument air distribution, cable tracing, junction boxes and instrument houses. Basically the whole installation, expect for piping and vessels, should completely be renewed. The additional challenge was that the construction phase should be carried out during the sixth annual inspection stop which was only 9 months away. 
I started the job and in a very short timeframe we were able to set up a dedicated team comprising Litecad and Emmtec engineers.  By strict management of the timeline, the engineering deliverables, DSC/ESD tendering, procurement, Factory Acceptance Testing, Site Acceptance testing, Commissioning, and startup of the plant we were able to deliver the project safe and according plan. As a team we succeeded due to our excellent technical skills, our capability to focus on the critical items and our mentality to deliver.
profile_positions.title: Engineering Management - Project delivery

profile_positions.description: The "BLNG re-instrumentation Project 'concerns the execution of a feed (Front End Engineering Design) for the Brunei LNG plant . The operating company—Brunei LNG Sdn Bhd—is owned by the Government of Brunei (50%), Shell and Mitsubishi Corporation (both 25%). Brunei LNG operates 5 LNG trains and produces 6.71 million tonnes every year of Liquified Natural gas.The BLNG plant is one of the first LNG production facilities in the world and the current plant control and safeguarding system (Foxboro DCS and Honeywell ESD system) is in the end-of-lifecycle phase. The scope of the project involves supplying a Basic Design Engineering Package (BDEP) including Project Execution Plan, planning and a 10% cost estimate. My responsibilities included the daily management of the engineering team.
profile_positions.title: Senior Project Engineer

profile_positions.description: The "Garijp Treatment Center DCS Migration Project" concerned the replacement of the obsolete control system by a new distributed control system. This system has been selected by means of a tendering procedure. This project is quite unique as the majority of the control loops have been migrated to the new system in a live plant.  By executing the project in this way the downtime of the plant has been minimized to the maximum extend.  My responsibilities included, engineering management vendor management, Factory Acceptance Testing (FAT), Site Acceptance Testing, commissioning and startup.
profile_positions.title: Engineering and Commissioning management

profile_positions.description: The control system of the Garijp Treatment Center of Vermilion had been declared obsolete by the Vendor. This procedure included preparation of a request for proposal, long and short listing, and technical and commercial bid evaluation.  Based upon the outcome of the evaluation the new system has been purchased and installed (see other Vermilion project).
profile_positions.title: Tendering Manager

profile_positions.description: AVEBE is an innovating company producing solutions based on potato starch for food, paper, building, textiles, adhesives and feed industries. The scope of the project was the merge of various control rooms that were located in various parts of the plant, into one central control room (CCK). profile_positions.title: Construction and Commissioning management

profile_positions.description: The Zuidwending project (joint venture of Gasunie and Nuon) concerns the design and engineering of an underground gas storage plant. The main function of this facility is peak shaving. Gas is stored underground and when demand is high, production is quickly ramped up and gas is delivered to the gas grid. For this project my responsibilities included the instrumentation and control engineering activities
profile_positions.title: Instrumentation Control Engineer

profile_positions.description: New standards have been set for mitigation of cybersecurity from the headquarters of Total E & P in Paris. These standards apply to the internal and external security of production control and safeguarding systems. For the roll out of these new standards a focal point (competence manager) is appointed for this topic. To create an overall picture for the situation in the Netherlands I have performed together with the competence manager a so called GAP (good / average / poor) analysis. The outcome of the analysis indicated clearly if there where derogations with respect to the new global standards.
